definitions.definition: A wild , headlong running away or scamper of a number of animals , usually caused by fright .

subdefinitions.definition: A situation in which many people in a crowd are trying to move in the same direction at the same time , especially in consequence of a panic .
examples: The annual Muslim Hajj in Mecca, Saudi Arabia, which is attended by millions of pilgrims, has increasingly suffered from stampedes .

subdefinitions.definition: An event at which cowboy skills are displayed ; a rodeo .

definitions.definition: A sudden unconcerted acting together of a number of persons due to, or as if due to, some common impulse .
examples: a stampede toward US bonds in the credit markets

main_definition: A wild , headlong running away or scamper of a number of animals , usually caused by fright .
secondary_definitions: ( figurative ) A sudden unconcerted acting together of a number of persons due to, or as if due to, some common impulse .
